column4: sorry scguy318...  DCHPDISCOVERY is looking to 255.255.255.255
but my fisty isn't picking up it's dhcp assigned address.
what are you trying to do?
I'm trying to access the internet.
you are now are you not?
Ubunto Box has a Linksys Instant gigabit card, (Works great in WinXP) wired to a Linksys WRTP54G voice router.
okay, your XP is dual booting with linux?
or that ubuntu is another separate machine?
is the router also acting as dHCP server?
how did you test this? are you using dhclient?
I have the router pages up on the laptop, so I have the Client table.  In ubuntu I'm in Terminal using ifconfig and Firefox.
what command you typed in ubuntu to recognize these?
I'm using ifconfig to check addresses and subnet, scguy318 suggested I use sudo ifup and ifdown to release/renew Ip addresses.
and what happens when you did do a ifdown and ifup? did you verify you have an ip address assigned? did you check /var/log/messages for telltale signs?
if it has 169.254.x.x it didnt get to talk to the dhcp server
That's the direction I was going in.  when I ran ifup, DCHPDISCOVER was broadcasting DHCP requests to the wrong subnet, but I don't know if that's relevant.
try man dhclient  to give you info on how to acquire ip address
man dhclient again..you used the wrong option it seems
